{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3338316,"name":"","username":"Hollisms","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/hollisms/{size}/110925_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-20T14:49:56.901Z","cooked":"

Our code is periodically crashing…. Likely because of out of memory issues….

However, I’m concerned that the auto restarts are masking the frequency of the issue. For debugging purposes is there an easy way to disable auto restarts temporarily? I couldn’t find something in the docs, so please share a link, etc. if it exists!

Thanks,

Hollis.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2024-03-20T14:49:56.901Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":88,"readers_count":87,"score":42.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":459440,"topic_slug":"how-to-stop-auto-code-restart-on-crash","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":36169,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Software Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/how-to-stop-auto-code-restart-on-crash/459440/1","custom_user_title":"Software Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3338375,"name":"Ken Schenke","username":"KPSch","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/c68b51/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-20T15:20:53.345Z","cooked":"

My information might be out of date but I’m hoping to point you in a direction that might help. There is a “watchdog” process on the Rio that monitors the robot code and restarts it if it dies. I have never experimented but it’s possible that disabling the watchdog process might prevent your code from restarting. This would involve SSH’ing into the Rio and working on the command-line.

If you modify your Rio to do this, I recommend reimaging it when you are done experimenting.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2024-03-20T15:20:53.345Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":76,"readers_count":75,"score":20.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":459440,"topic_slug":"how-to-stop-auto-code-restart-on-crash","display_username":"Ken Schenke","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":20675,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/how-to-stop-auto-code-restart-on-crash/459440/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3338459,"name":"Fletch","username":"Fletch1373","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fletch1373/{size}/220073_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-20T16:07:04.680Z","cooked":"

I dont know specifically about disabling that “watchdog process”, but you can disable the realtime startup app then ssh in and manually start the robot code app (your deployed jar if using java). If running manually, you should see the crash logged on the console and it won’t automatically restart on crash

We experience a similar problem this year with out of memory issues. Our RoboRIO v1 would run out of memory, the code crashes, and this cycle would continuously repeat.

What solved this issue for us was disabling the RoboRIO webserver via SSH.

We were able to verify that the issue of code restarts was because the Rio was running out of memory - the Driver Station does report the memory usage. The amount of reported unused memory would dwindle to 3MB before crashing for us.

Another way I would also recommend debugging is to check out DS Logs or the WPILogs on the Rio. The last system message the Rio would log would be the could not allocate memory error.

There were a couple CD links linked in the WPILib docs pull request which you can read more about here
